brief_summary.textblock:
This trial is undertaken to better understand the ranges of functional components normally
      found in human milk. This will strengthen the scientific knowledge on breast-milk
      composition as a "gold standard".

clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Normal Ranges of Lipids in Breast Milk of Healthy Mothers

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Gestational age between 37 and not above 42 weeks

          -  18 years old ≤ Mother ≤ 40 years old

          -  18.5 ≤ pre-pregnancy BMI ≤ 29

          -  Mothers willing to breastfeed for the first 4 months

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Gestational diabetes

          -  HTA < 140/90

          -  Mothers who are smokers while breast-feeding

primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of this trial is to determine the levels of lipids normally found in the breast-milk of healthy lactating mothers

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Secondary objectives include the measure of the profile and quantity of sugars found in human milk

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
